speaker: Skyline
text: Christmas lights on the Space Needle. _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Roz are seated at a table.  Martin comes in with Eddie. _

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hey, Dad.

speaker: Waiter
text: Cappuccino to go.  Holiday cookies, anyone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, I believe I will, thank you. _Frasier and Roz each take one.  Martin reaches for the plate, then pulls back._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, not for me.

speaker: Roz
text: Watching your weight?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and it's killing me.  But the other night, Ronee made a comment about my "bowl full of jelly."

speaker: Roz
text: Well, everyone puts on a few this time of year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone doesn't sit around reading the newspaper, actually slurping from a bowl full of jelly.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you look great to me, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks.

speaker: Roz
text: Merry Christmas.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Eddie and I must have walked about three miles. I'm sweating like a pig. _As he moves to take Roz's chair, Frasier hooks it with his foot and pulls it in._

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am saving that seat for someone who may not wish to have it bedewed with pig sweat.

speaker: Natalie
text: [_sultry French accent_] Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Natalie!

speaker: Natalie
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking her hand_] Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is my father, Martin Crane.  Uh, Natalie Blanc of the Seattle Tourism Board.  She wants me to do a promo for her. [_to her_] He was just leaving.

speaker: Natalie
text: Oh, that little dog is adorable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and he's smart as a chimp too!  Off you go! _He shoots Martin a meaningful look.  Martin takes the hint and goes to the counter._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_motions her to the seat_] Please.  It's so lovely to finally meet you.

speaker: Natalie
text: Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have a seat. [_she does_] So, tell me about this promo.

speaker: Natalie
text: Well, it's pretty simple.  It begins with you at home on the couch. [_hands him a script_] And you say...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "Anybody feel like taking a walk?  Then come to Seattle."

speaker: Natalie
text: And then we see you walking at the Space Needle, the beach, the fish market -- but we do all of that with special effects. It should only take a couple of hours tomorrow.  So, are you in?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_overcome by her accent_] I'm "een!" [_they laugh_] You know, it's funny, when you called me at the last minute, there was a small, madly insecure part of me that wondered if I was your second choice.

speaker: Natalie
text: No, you weren't the second. _Frasier pauses, struck by the double meaning there.  As Martin turns back with his coffee, Eddie jumps into Frasier's arms._

speaker: Natalie
text: Nice meeting you.

speaker: Martin
text: You too.

speaker: Natalie
text: Oh, that dog is so precious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, there are times when I could just squeeze him to death!

speaker: Natalie
text: You know, maybe he should be in the spot with you.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie in a commercial?

speaker: Natalie
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's called a spot, Dad.

speaker: Natalie
text: You look so perfect together.  He could just sit next to you on the couch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose there's no harm in a little window dressing.

speaker: Natalie
text: The director will love it.  I'll call him right now.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't believe it. [_pets Eddie_] Eddie's first TV spot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, knock it off.  You didn't even know that term until ten seconds ago. _As Natalie talks into her cell phone, Frasier sulkily makes a show of petting Eddie.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment The apartment is garishly decorated for Christmas, as it is every year. Martin is adding some finishing touches, when Frasier comes in, with Eddie on a leash._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Fras, how'd the big shoot go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it went splendidly, Dad.  I thought you were going with Niles to the airport to pick up Freddie.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I decided to stay home, do some decorating.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah yes, that magical time of year when the Great Wall of China and my apartment are the only two man-made structures visible from space.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must say I'm really excited about seeing Freddie this trip.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, what you got planned?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, everything from whale-watching to a trip to the garlic festival. _He opens the door to Niles and Daphne, who both have fake smiles pasted on to cover their shock.  They come in and sink onto the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Daphne...!  Where's Frederick?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, he insisted on taking his own elevator.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Oh, priceless!  You know, just when you worried that he's on the brink of terrible teendom, there he is, still just a little boy who wants to play in the elevator. _The elevator opens behind Frasier's back, and there is Frederick: he is dressed head-to-toe in black leather and denim, his hair is dyed black, and his face is paler than Lilith's, except for his eyes and lips, which are alsoblackened.  Steel jewelry hangs from his neck and belt._

speaker: Freddie
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: There he is...

speaker: Freddie
text: Nice greeting, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Freddie, why are you dressed like this?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still smiling_] He's a Goth now.

speaker: Freddie
text: You all don't have to treat me like I'm some kind of freak.

speaker: Martin
text: No, we're not, Freddie.  It's great to see you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_aside to Frasier_] Maybe you could move up that trip to the garlic festival.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Freddie, I don't understand.  Um, the Goths were plunderers.  Apart from your tendency to be overaggressive with your rooks at chess camp, I don't see the connection.

speaker: Freddie
text: It's just what I'm into now, okay?  Me, my friend Andi, a bunch of us.  But if you don't get it, you don't get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't mean anything by it, I simply thought... [_Freddie exits_] Oh, dear God!  Well, thank you Lilith, for mentioning this little development!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's just a phase.  All teenagers go through a rebellious period.  It always passes.  You should have seen me at that age -- dating the older boys, hitch-hiking, drinking, shop- lifting.  Do you know I can carry a frozen turkey between my knees? _Niles, for whom this is more than he ever wanted to know, rises stiffly and walks to the bar._

speaker: Niles
text: That'll come in handy if we ever misplace our serving platter at Thanksgiving.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, and didn't you once tell me you went streaking?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I had shin splints at the time, so it was really more of a brisk nude walk.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you do, Niles?  How did you rebel?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the usual ways.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Like what?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, like what?  Well, uh...

speaker: Martin
text: Never happened, Niles.  Your mother and I kept waiting for it.

speaker: Niles
text: [_stung_] I find it hard to believe that I never...

speaker: Martin
text: Nope, nope.  You were one of those good kids.  One time I found a bag of something that looked suspicious in your dresser, but it turned out to be just something to make your sweaters smell nice.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, one time...

speaker: Martin
text: Face it, Niles -- you just didn't have it in you to be bad.  [_N.B. Martin is perhaps doing Niles an injustice here.  Earlier mention was made of him mooning President Nixon at a campaign rally, in[[2.18]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_18/the_club.html "The Club"), "The Club."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Freddie, hi.  Listen, I was thinking maybe we could take in a movie tonight.

speaker: Freddie
text: Can't, Dad.  I made plans with my friend Andi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Your friend Andi from school is here?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yeah, visiting relatives.  We're seeing a movie.

speaker: Frasier
text: But you just got here.

speaker: Freddie
text: We've got all week, okay?  Be cool. _He opens the door to Andi -- a girl decked out exactly the same as he is -- but for her long hair, it's difficult to see any difference in gender. _

speaker: Freddie
text: Hey.

speaker: Andi
text: Hey.

speaker: Freddie
text: Well, see ya.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, at least he's not dating outside the faith. HIGH HOLIDAYS _Scene Three -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier is seated alone at the table in the rear.  A husband with his pregnant wife comes over. _

speaker: Husband
text: Excuse me, are you using this chair?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_charmed_] Well, doesn't that have a familiar ring to it? [_stands to offer the chair_] The weary holiday traveler and his pregnant wife seeking kindness from a stranger...

speaker: Natalie
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: ...I'm afraid I am, yes.  So...

speaker: Natalie
text: I'm so glad I ran into you. [_to waiter_] Um, cappuccino to go, please.

speaker: Natalie
text: The ad agency loves the spot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Natalie
text: Apparently they got quite creative with it.  I'll messenger you a copy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's wonderful news.  Listen, I realize you're dashing off, but do you think we could celebrate tonight over a drink?

speaker: Natalie
text: Sure.  How about, uh... 7:00 at Garagiste?

speaker: Frasier
text: Could you say that again?

speaker: Natalie
text: Garagiste.  You don't know it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, I do.  I just love hearing you say it.

speaker: Natalie
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me get that for you. [_pays_]

speaker: Natalie
text: Thank you.  I'll see you then.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, take care.

speaker: Natalie
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that was a yummy little stocking stuffer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  She's the one I told you about.  The girl with the accent.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, she could read me the phone book, and I would melt like an overripe Camembert.  Imagine what she would do with that -- [_imitating her_] _Camembert._

speaker: Niles
text: _R-R-R-Roquefort._

speaker: Frasier
text: _Reblochon._

speaker: Niles
text: _Blu._

speaker: Frasier
text: We're terrible!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_more sober_] Well, at least it will be nice to have something to do this evening -- for a change.

speaker: Niles
text: Is Frederick still spending all his time with his little ghoul-friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they're going to a concert this evening.  And, of course, I don't begrudge him a social life, it's just that I feel so rejected.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking around_] Mm.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, when one has something they'd clearly rather do than spend time with you, it just feels like...

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I'm waiting for someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it really bothered me when said that I never rebelled. I mean, I've been obsessing about it.  What kind of self- respecting psychiatrist -- not to mention father-to-be -- completely misses one of life's prime rites of passage? So... I've decided to rebel tonight. [_grins_] Right under Dad's nose.

speaker: Frasier
text: How?

speaker: Niles
text: You ready?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: You sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Positive.

speaker: Niles
text: Move your coffee, it might...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_proudly_] I'm getting high on reefer.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: I've waited for this all my life, Frasier -- one act of utter, devil-may-care, crotch-grabbing brazenness!  And of course I'll have a nurse on speed-dial in case things get too hairy.

speaker: Frasier
text: And exactly which of your connections in the Seattle demimonde is going to get you this reefer?

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, Niles, you're hooked up.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, oh... I'll just take a look. [_does so_] Ah, yes, thick and gooey.  Ganja in its purest form.

speaker: Roz
text: It's a pot brownie, you idiot.  My neighbor makes them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh. _Niles re-wraps the brownie and is about to put it in his pocket, but then hears his car alarm go off._

speaker: Niles
text: Damn it, my car alarm again!  I'll be right back.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait!  But Niles...!  Well, I can't wait, I got a date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're not leaving that thing with me.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, Frasier, just give it to Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, I refuse.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just stop that, stop that.  It is illegal.  I will have nothing to do with it, for God's sakes.  What do you take me for, some kind of common drug mule?

speaker: Roz
text: [_as he's leaving_] "Mule" is one word for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hey Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: How are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll see you back at home. [_exits_]

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, how you doing, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Good.  How are the holidays treating you?

speaker: Waiter
text: Cookie?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh... no, just trying to stay away from things that are bad for me. _Roz spots her date -- a man in a Santa suit whose pulls his beard down to below his chin, revealing an "in the mood for love" grin. _

speaker: Roz
text: [_grins back_] Well, that's where you and I are different. [_hands Martin the brownie_] Can you give this to Niles? He'll be right back.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure. [_Roz leaves_] Uh, coffee to go, please. _Martin sits at a table to wait.  Curious, he unwraps the packet and sees the brownie.  Wincing, he pushes it away.  A moment passes, as he wrestles with his sweet tooth.  Then he gives in and breaks off a small piece and eats it._

speaker: Martin
text: Mmm... mmm... _He breaks off another piece and eats it, then just shoves the whole thing in his mouth and licks the wrapper clean, enjoying every bit of it.  He looks out the window and sees Niles coming back, and hastily goes to the counter._

speaker: Martin
text: [_mouth full_] Could I have a brownie, please?

speaker: Waiter
text: Okay. _Getting the brownie, he quickly re-wraps it.  Niles comes back in and looks around for Roz, then sees Martin, who is getting his coffee._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hey, Niles.  Um, uh, Roz wanted me to give you this.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes the brownie_] Thank you.  Hey, uh, you're going to be home tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm walking home right now.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good.  I'll see you there.  Have a nice trip.

speaker: Martin
text: You, too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the double meaning_] Oh, I will! _Niles chortles in anticipation -- then turns and sees two uniformed Police officers in the cafe, staring at him curiously.  He starts hyperventilating and lurches out of the cafe, keeping his head bowed. They stare after him, perplexed.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Apartment Later that evening, Frasier is seated on the couch, reading.  Freddie and Andi come in.  Freddie is carrying a parcel. _

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Freddie.  Oh, Andi.  How was the mall?

speaker: Freddie
text: Boring.

speaker: Andi
text: Except when that fat kid threw up in Santa's beard.  That was goth.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_hands him the package_] Oh, the doorman had this for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, this must be my tourism promo!  I'll tell you what -- why don't we have a look at it?

speaker: Freddie
text: I just came to get a jacket.  We're going to the concert.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Freddie.  You can spare a couple of minutes to check out your old man's debut as a spokesman.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking for the remote_] All right, where is that...? [_finds it_] Here we go. _Sitting on Martin's chair, he turns on the TV and pops in the tape.  On the screen, they see nothing but a close-up of Eddie sitting on a couch -- his lips are moving with the aid of computer effects. _

speaker: Eddie
text: [_in Frasier's voice_] Anybody want to go for a walk? Then why not come to Seattle?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God! _As Eddie continues speaking, a set of postcards scroll by his head to show what he is talking about._

speaker: Eddie
text: Where else can you see... an ocean wave, a fish fly, a mountain peak, and the world's largest needle?  Come to Seattle.  Let's go for a walk. _The spot ends.  Frasier is outraged, Freddie and Andi are, for once, entertained._

speaker: Freddie
text: That is so goth.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not goth!  It's outrageous!  It's like some hideous Frankenstein hybrid of me and that no-talent dog!

speaker: Freddie
text: [_gets up_] Let's go.  By the way, I'm staying at Andi's tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Freddie
text: At her uncle's.  We have plans all day tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Frederick, you're not staying anywhere until I hear from her uncle first.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_mortified_] Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, but that is the rule.

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad! [_then, to Andi_] I'll meet you downstairs.

speaker: Freddie
text: Do you know how much you're embarrassing me?  What's your problem?!

speaker: Frasier
text: My problem is that you've hardly spent one minute here since you arrived!  Now you tell me you have plans all day tomorrow.

speaker: Freddie
text: You're really making me want to spend time with you now.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_settling_] I'd like to know when you're going to be home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tomorrow, okay?  I'll have her uncle call you. [_goes to the door_] I never should have come here in the first place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Freddie... _Freddie leaves, passing Niles in the hallway.  Niles comes in, grinning._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.  What's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just another joyous holiday moment with my son to be pasted into my scrapbook.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah. [_then, eager_] Aren't you going to ask me what's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't intend to, no.

speaker: Niles
text: I'd like you to.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: [_gleefully_] I am.  I'm as high as the Himalayas!  If I were a city in Germany, I'd be High-delburg!  Is Dad home yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll use this opportunity to up my dosage. _He takes out the remainder of the "pot brownie," and eats another small piece._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles!  You realize that this is illegal?  Did you actually drive yourself here?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm a little too toasted for that, Frasier.  No, the minute I knew I was getting baked tonight, I called a cab.  And I printed my name and address on a card in my pocket in case I'm still too crispy to speak to the cab driver taking me home.

speaker: Frasier
text: I judge by all this rich terminology that you've done some research?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I know all the symptoms I can expect to experience.  I'm especially looking forward to something called the "munchies" stage.  It's where one enjoys bizarre food combinations. [_opens the shopping bag he's carrying_] I'm thinking of pairing this Chilean sea bass with an aggressive Zinfandel!

speaker: Frasier
text: And this is all to prove a point to Dad?

speaker: Niles
text: To Dad, and for myself.  Don't I have the right, just once, to sip the sweet nectar of rebellion? _They turn as they hear Martin fitting his key into the door -- or trying to, he keeps fumbling and dropping them, while bursting into peals of hysterical laughter. _

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I've got to go put a jacket on for my date. Why don't you go see if you can help Dad at the door? _Frasier exits.  Niles opens the door to Martin, who stumbles in grinning like an idiot.  He is carrying a jumbo bag of barbecue potato chips, and a tub of chocolate pudding._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Funny you should say that!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, it is! _They laugh hilariously, and Martin tosses his keys toward the counter, where they fall short and drop to the floor.  Then Martin apparently becomes serious._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, hey, Niles, let me ask you something.  Do you ever feel like you'd just like to go straight?

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, I was walking home, and I kept thinking about all the turns we have to make -- right turn, left turn.  How much easier it'd be if we just could go straight over the trees, over a building.  That's what a giant would do.  They should let everybody be a giant for a day. _Niles, thinking it's all just a vision of his own "trip," bursts into giggles, making Martin laugh again._

speaker: Niles
text: If you had any idea how strange you seem to me right now.

speaker: Martin
text: Why is everybody saying that to me?

speaker: Martin
text: By the way, you are welcome.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... for what?

speaker: Martin
text: For turning you on to the best thing you will ever eat: barbecue pudding chips! _Of course, Niles doesn't believe even a stoned person would go for those, but Martin opens the bag and dips a chip in the pudding._

speaker: Niles
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, they looked at me funny in the store, too, but you taste that and tell me that's not better than a woman. _He holds out the chip, Niles recoils.  CUT TO: Living Room Frasier trots out with his jacket, then sees Eddie sitting in his path._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I see.  Now you're such a big star that the whole world has to revolve around you.  Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_through the door_] I'll tell you what.  You just gloat all you like.  This is not over between us! _CUT TO: the kitchen Martin is still eating chips, while Niles is chopping some vegetables for his dinner._

speaker: Martin
text: Why am I putting these chips in this pudding?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I was going to say.

speaker: Martin
text: I should be dumping the pudding in with the chips! [_does so_] You know, I've been having these great ideas all day.  I wrote some of them down. [_takes a writing pad out of his breast pocket_] There.  What do you think this means? [_reads_] "Dog army."  Oh, that cold medicine I took this morning is making me feel funny.  I think I'm going to go sit down for a while. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Whatever. _Reset to: the living room. Martin brings the chips out, and sits down into his chair with a grateful sigh.  He turns on the TV.  On the screen:_

speaker: Eddie
text: [_in Frasier's voice_] Anybody want to go for a walk?

speaker: Eddie
text: Then why not come to Seattle?

speaker: Martin
text: Sweet mother!

speaker: Eddie
text: Where else can you see... an ocean wave, a fish fly, a mountain peak, and the world's largest needle?  Come to Seattle.  Let's go for a walk.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s., from the powder room_] I know what you're doing! _Martin turns and sees Eddie sitting on the floor, staring -- and apparently speaking -- at him. _

speaker: Frasier
text: You're sitting there thinking you're the king!  Well, you're not!

speaker: Martin
text: [_towards the kitchen, in panic_] Niles?! _Frasier comes out of the powder room as Niles comes out with the carving knife in one hand and the vegetables in the other._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'm off to my date.  Oh, for heaven's sake, Niles!  That knife is as sharp as a machete.  You should not be chopping with it in your condition. [_exits_] Do that for him, will you, Dad? _He leaves, as Martin hesitantly rises, still staring at Eddie.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Five -- Frasier's Kitchen A little later, the two Crane men are hunched over their dinners -- Niles, with his jacket off and lazily lulled over the range, is cooking his vegetables.  Martin is eating vanilla ice cream directly from the carton. _

speaker: Niles
text: I've come dangerously close to over-braising my chard. [_proud_] It's almost as if something dulled my motor skills.

speaker: Martin
text: You sure you don't want a little of this on the side?  I can scoop around the Lucky Charms.

speaker: Niles
text: No, thanks. _He goes out into the living room and takes his seat at the dining table._

speaker: Niles
text: You know me, Dad.  I'm not much of a rebel. [_he carelessly flings his napkin onto the floor_] Too much of a goody-two- shoes. _He gleefully pours himself wine, still in the throes of his psychosomatic intoxication.  Frasier trudges in the door, looking worn-out and depressed._

speaker: Niles
text: [_picks his napkin up_] Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s., from the kitchen_] But you've got to open your mind up. That's where all the great inventions come from.  Like, it used to be people would eat too much, their pants would get tight!  Big problem!  Then one day, somebody said, "Wait a minute!  Why not put elastic in them?" _Martin comes out carrying the ice cream carton -- his pants and shoes are gone, he's only wearing boxers and socks below the waist. _

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, where are your pants?

speaker: Martin
text: In the fridge. [_off Frasier's look_] I had a reason. [_shows his pad of paper_] "Fridge pants."

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, when you were at the cafe today, you didn't eat a brownie that Roz brought for Niles, did you?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah - but I replaced it.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake!  That was a pot brownie!  You're stoned off your ass!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, someone must feel pretty out of it, being the only one here who isn't completely burnt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, knock it off, you imbecile, you're as sober as I am!

speaker: Martin
text: I knew I was feeling woozy.  I thought it was that cold medicine I took this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes the ice cream and holds Martin's arm_] It's all right, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God, I am so sorry.  Dad, are you all right?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'll be fine.  But I better go lie down before it really hits me.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be in there in a minute to check on you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, suit yourself, Eddie!

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't it occur to you that he was behaving strangely?

speaker: Niles
text: I thought it was me!  I thought it was the Mary Jane talking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, please, will you drop the drug lingo?

speaker: Niles
text: [_his face in his hands_] Frasier, I feel terrible.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, at least you had a better night than I did.  Halfway through our date, Natalie got a phone call - an emergency at home. [_chuckles bitterly_] I decided to take a little walk. Twenty minutes later I saw her in a different bar with another man.

speaker: Niles
text: There was no emergency?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not unless he had an infected earlobe which required an immediate tongue-flicking.  It's been a hell of a Christmas.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so sorry, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Truth be told, I'm most disappointed about how things turned out with Frederick.  I've just felt us drifting apart lately, and I was hoping that we could bond again on this trip.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you may have given him a wonderful gift just by letting him rebel against you.

speaker: Niles
text: Something which I am obviously completely incapable of achieving.  I'm going home.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're a good man, Niles.  In a way, isn't that rebelling against rebellion?

speaker: Niles
text: [_smiles_] Nice try.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, look at it this way -- you did get our cop father stoned tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with a cocky grin_] I did, didn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah. _Niles exits with a swagger.  Frasier smiles to himself, then sees the place setting Niles laid out for himself._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm... [_checks the label on the wine_] Oh, madness!

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick.

speaker: Freddie
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing home?  I thought you were spending the night at Andi's.

speaker: Freddie
text: I changed my mind.  Good night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did something happen at the concert?

speaker: Freddie
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?  I can't help noticing your mascara's run a little.

speaker: Freddie
text: Andi ran into a "friend" from her old school.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah... another boy?

speaker: Freddie
text: She hardly talked to me the whole night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, son.  These things happen, and... well, they always stink.

speaker: Freddie
text: Did it ever happen to you, Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: It may have.  Tell you what -- you know, I've got a box of that cereal you used to like.  What do you say I pour us a bowl and I'll tell you a story or two.

speaker: Freddie
text: It's happened to you more than once?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles, then_] I'll pour you a big bowl.
